episodes.name: Good Night
episodes.overview:
Good Night was the first ever Simpsons short to air on The Tracey Ullman Show. The five main family members - Homer, Marge, Bart, Lisa, and Maggie - were first introduced in this short. Homer and Marge attempt to calm their children to sleep, with the opposite results. 

Maggie can be heard saying "good night". She rarely talks throughout the run of the series.

episodes.name: Watching TV
episodes.overview:
Bart and Lisa quarrel during commercial breaks over what channel they'll watch. Repeatedly Maggie comes up to the television and changes the channel. Later Homer is saying some speech about family matters then stops when the show comes back on.

A piece of music from the Tracey Ullman show plays at one part or another during the short.

episodes.name: Jumping Bart
episodes.overview:
Homer makes several attempts to have Bart jump into his arms. Each time Bart jumps Homer is distracted and fails to catch him. 

Towards the end of the episode boxing gloves are delivered, presumably the ones used in the episode Punching Bag.

episodes.name: Babysitting Maggie
episodes.overview:
Marge puts Bart and Lisa in charge of babysitting Maggie. They watch TV while Maggie gets electrocuted, falls down the stairs, and falls off the roof. 

Maggie sticks a fork in an electrical socket thereby electocuting herself, she crawls up the stairs and falls down them in insane Slinky fashion then she climbs onto the roof in hot pursuit of a butterfly, and falls off it.

episodes.name: The Pacifier
episodes.overview: Lisa and Bart try to get Maggie to stop sucking on her pacifier, but Maggie, who has an entire drawer full of them, refuses to kick the habit.

episodes.name: Burping Contest
episodes.overview: Despite Marge's objections, Bart, Lisa and even Maggie compete in a contest to see who can make the most disgusting burp.

episodes.name: Dinner Time
episodes.overview: Marge serves the family purple goop for dinner, insisting that they say grace first.

episodes.name: Making Faces
episodes.overview: Despite Marge's warnings, the kids make faces. Maggie unclearly speaks in this episode.

episodes.name: The Funeral
episodes.overview:
Bart is determined to see his uncle's corpse...but not for long. 

This is the only appearance of Uncle Hubert.

episodes.name: Maggie's Brain
episodes.overview: Bart and Lisa wonder what's inside Maggie's mind.

episodes.name: Football
episodes.overview: Homer teaches Bart about the importance of Football.

episodes.name: House of Cards
episodes.overview: Bart tries to make a house of cards, but Lisa & Maggie make noises that have the "house" fall every time.

episodes.name: Bart and Homer's Dinner
episodes.overview: Bart can't stomach it when he and Homer are forced to fend for themselves.

episodes.name: Space Patrol
episodes.overview:
Bart, Lisa and Maggie play a game of "Space Patrol" while Homer and Marge are out. 

Lisa plays a superhero with Maggie as her sidekick, while Bart puts a jug on his head with the pretense of it being the helmet of an alien warlord.

However, his head accidentally plops into it and the jug is left stuck on his head. Lisa "frees" Bart from the jug using a croquet mallet. Lisa and Maggie then hide, allowing Bart, stumbling in a daze amongst pieces of the precious broken jug lying on the floor, to take the blame.

episodes.name: Bart's Haircut
episodes.overview:
Bart has his hair cut too short by a barber. 

This is the first time we hear a character from The Simpsons series say a curse word.

episodes.name: World War III
episodes.overview: Homer wakes up the family to practice for a nuclear drill... in the middle of the night.

episodes.name: The Perfect Crime
episodes.overview:
Marge bakes a batch of delicious cookies. Bart attempts to steal them, but burns his fingers trying to pick them up. Everyone except Bart and Maggie leave the kitchen to let them cool down, and Bart takes this opportunity to swipe them, muttering to himself "Aha! The perfect crime!" 

Homer and Marge come back to find the tray empty. Marge suspects Maggie of eating the cookies, but as a witness she knows exactly who took them and guides them along a trail of cookies running across the floor. His family catch him lying on his back in his bedroom amidst a pile of cookie crumbs. Looking up at them with his stomach full, he groans, "There is no perfect crime." His head bangs back down on the ground and Maggie, secretively, snacks on an uneaten cookie.

episodes.name: Scary Stories
episodes.overview: Bart tells Lisa & Maggie a series of scary stories (in the middle of the dark) only to believe they're coming true.

episodes.name: Grampa and the Kids
episodes.overview:
Grampa spends time with the kids. 

This is Grampa's first appearance.

episodes.name: Gone Fishin'
episodes.overview: Bart and Homer go on a fishing trip. Homer asks Bart for a bologna sandwich, but Bart forgot the bologna. He puts the bait on the sandwich instead. Later on they hit rapids and Homer is almost knocked unconscious. They later fall off of a waterfall.

episodes.name: Skateboarding
episodes.overview: Bart teaches his sisters how to skateboard...or is it the other way around.

episodes.name: The Pagans
episodes.overview:
The kids discuss paganism. 

This is the first time Bart calls his dad "Homer".

episodes.name: Closeted
episodes.overview: Bart locks himself in the closet, and when he busts out, he finds out that the family has gone out without him.

episodes.name: The Aquarium
episodes.overview:
At an aquarium Bart swims with the sharks...literally. 
This is the first time we see a naked Simpsons character. 
This also marks Lisa Simpson saying the word hell in this short.

episodes.name: Family Portrait
episodes.overview: Homer has trouble taking a normal family portrait.

episodes.name: Bart's Hiccups
episodes.overview: Lisa and Maggie try to cure Bart's hiccups...the hard way.

episodes.name: The Money Jar
episodes.overview: The kids try to steal money from Marge's money jar..

episodes.name: The Art Museum
episodes.overview:
The Simpsons go to the art museum. 
This is the first time we hear Bart say "Whoooa, Mama!".

episodes.name: Zoo Story
episodes.overview:
Homer unwisely teases a monkey at the zoo and gets a faceful of poo for his trouble. 
This is the shortest Simpsons Short.

episodes.name: Shut Up, Simpsons
episodes.overview: Maggie squeaks her toy, causing a chain reaction of anger in the family.

episodes.name: Shell Game
episodes.overview: Bart tries to hide the cookies he stole from the jar from his parents.

episodes.name: The Bart Simpson Show
episodes.overview:
Bart puts on his own show after Homer tells him to stop watching cartoons. First appearance of Itchy and Scratchy. 
This is the first time we hear Lisa call her dad "Homer".

episodes.name: Punching Bag
episodes.overview: Bart, Lisa and eventually Marge take out their frustrations on a punching bag with Homer's picture on it.

episodes.name: Simpsons Christmas
episodes.overview: Bart's version of Christmas.

episodes.name: The Krusty the Clown Show
episodes.overview: The kids get to see Krusty's show live for the first time. First appearance of Krusty the Clown.

episodes.name: Bart the Hero
episodes.overview: Sent out to exercise, Bart foils a robbery attempt.

episodes.name: Bart's Little Fantasy
episodes.overview: Bart tells a story about large kids who throw their small parents into a small room.

episodes.name: Scary Movie
episodes.overview: Bart, Lisa and Maggie go to the movie to see "The Happy Little Elves Return" (much to Bart's dismay), but Bart convinces the girls to see "Space Mutants" instead. Guess who's the scaredy-cat!

episodes.name: Home Hypnotism
episodes.overview: Homer tries hypnosis to calm down his crazy kids.

episodes.name: Shoplifting
episodes.overview: Bart's attempt to swipe some chocolate is foiled.

episodes.name: Echo Canyon
episodes.overview: The family drives to Echo Canyon, takes turns making echoes, and Bart almost makes a boulder crunch the family car.

episodes.name: Bathtime
episodes.overview: Homer makes Bart take his "Sunday Night Bath", only to flood the bathroom.

episodes.name: Bart's Nightmare
episodes.overview: In this sequel to "Shell Game", Bart has a nightmare after eating every single cookie from the cookie jar.

episodes.name: Bart of the Jungle
episodes.overview: The kids swing from the trees off Homer's ties.

episodes.name: Family Therapy
episodes.overview:
Homer takes the family to a psychologist. 
This is last Tracey Ullman Short we hear a character from The Simpsons series say a curse word.

episodes.name: Maggie in Peril (Chapter One)
episodes.overview: Bart kicks Maggie's ball out of sight and she takes off to retrieve it back. (To be Continued...)

episodes.name: Maggie in Peril (The Thrilling Conclusion)
episodes.overview: Part 2. Maggie floats in the air hanging on to balloons and lands safely back in her playpen.

episodes.name: TV Simpsons
episodes.overview: Homer attempts to fix the television antenna on the roof.

episodes.name: Springfield's Most Wanted
episodes.overview: This special was aired before the premier of the 7th season opener; hosted by John Walsh (from the FOX series "Americas Most Wanted"), it offered up all sorts of theories and insights into who might have shot Montgomery Burns.

episodes.name: The Simpsons Movie
episodes.overview: After Homer pollutes the town's water supply, Springfield is encased in a gigantic dome by the EPA and the Simpsons are declared fugitives.

episodes.name: The Simpsons' Christmas Message
episodes.overview: Marge comments on David and Victoria Beckham's marriage in a negative comparison with hers and Homer's, and compared the special relationship between the UK and the US to that of Mini Me and Dr. Evil in the Austin Powers films ("Helping out in all our zany schemes to take over the world"). Lisa Simpson also held a banner supporting Cornwall's secession: "UK OUT OF CORNWALL", while chanting "Rydhsys rag Kernow lemmyn" (freedom for Cornwall now).

episodes.name: A Culture Show Special
episodes.overview: Not long before the anticipated release of their movie, and after celebrating the 400th episode and 20 years, The Culture Show paid homage to the great success of The Simpsons with this special half-hour documentary about them. Hosted by Lauren Laverne (who co-hosts Culture Show along with the great film critic Mark Kermode), this programme basically looked back from their first appearance on The Tracey Ullman Show in 1987 and episodes gone by to see why everyone loves this cartoon sitcom so much. This included the key and supporting characters, the jokes, the celebrity appearances, the writers, the mocking of everyday things, and much more, a great one-off documentary with plenty of clips, information and opinion to keep you interested. With contributions from creator Matt Groening, Ricky Gervais, Nick Park, Stephen Hawking, Phill Jupitus, Helen Fielding and Johnny Vegas.

episodes.name: The Simpsons 20th Anniversary Special: in 3-D! On Ice!
episodes.overview: Academy Award-nominated filmmaker Morgan Spurlock takes on the behemoth task of documenting 20 years of the global phenomenon that is THE SIMPSONS. In his distinctive and innovative style, the unprecedented one-hour special follows Spurlock as he sets off on a cross-country globe-trotting mission combing the streets for interviews from fans young and old. His travels take him from the home of THE SIMPSONS' biggest fan to the organization at the center of THE SIMPSONS' biggest controversies to landmarks such as the birthplace of "Groundskeeper Willie" and the Springfield Isotopes' playing field. In addition, Spurlock talks to cast, writers and celebrities about the undying cultural obsession with THE SIMPSONS.

episodes.name: Access All Areas
episodes.overview: In the first of Sky One's specials celebrating 20 years of "The Simpsons", Ricky Gervais takes you behind the scenes to see how the show is made, talking to those who put each episode together, plus celebrity fans like Simon Cowell and Hugh Hefner.

episodes.name: The Simpsons Balenciaga
episodes.overview: Homer forgets to buy Marge a birthday present, and while looking for ideas finds her sleeping with a Balenciaga catalog and writes to them, asking if they can send him their cheapest product with the Balenciaga logo on it, or even just a tag.

episodes.name: Te Deseo Lo Mejor
episodes.overview: Bad Bunny helps Homer and Marge in the video for his new single Te Deseo Lo Mejor.  The Puerto Rican pop star rekindles the flame between the two lovers.

episodes.name: The Longest Daycare
episodes.overview: In this Oscar-nominated short from The Simpsons, Maggie must navigate an eventful first day in daycare. At the Ayn Rand School for Tots, Maggie is diagnosed with average intelligence. Barred from the gifted children, she longs to escape from her glue-guzzling classmates. But when a lonely caterpillar befriends her, she makes it her mission to save it from a ruthless butterfly smashing toddler.

episodes.name: Planet of the Couches
episodes.overview: To celebrate the series’ 600th episode, The Simpsons and Google have come together to create a special Virtual Reality experience. Produced with Google Spotlight Stories, The Simpsons couch gag, “Planet of the Couches,” is available on both Android and iOS. View it with any Google Cardboard viewer for the full VR experience.

episodes.name: Springfield of Dreams: The Legend of Homer Simpson
episodes.overview: The special, which satirizes Ken Burns' seminal documentary miniseries Baseball, will pay tribute to the episode "Homer at the Bat" while offering up interviews from eight of the baseball stars who appeared as ringers in the episode, as well as Yankees All-Star Aaron Judge, Nick Offerman, Russell Brand, George Will, Tim Gunn, and Dr. Oz, not to mention sportscasters Bob Costas, Joe Buck, Bob Uecker, and Charissa Thompson. In addition, the documentary includes "interviews" with Homer, Moe, Chief Wiggum, Apu, and Comic Book Guy.

episodes.name: Playdate with Destiny
episodes.overview: Maggie and Marge are having a play-date at Springfield's finest toddler play park when Maggie becomes smitten with a little boy. It's love at first suck and Maggie dreams about seeing him again after a day full of make-believe romance.

episodes.name: Maggie Simpson in “The Force Awakens From Its Nap”
episodes.overview: In a daycare, far, far away... but still in Springfield, Maggie is on an epic quest for her stolen pacifier. Her adventure brings her face-to-face with young Padawans, Sith Lords, familiar droids, Rebel scum, and an ultimate battle against the dark side, in this original short celebrating the Star Wars galaxy.

episodes.name: The Good, the Bart, and the Loki
episodes.overview: Loki joins forces with Bart Simpson to fight against his toughest opponents in Springfield after he is banished from Asgard yet again.

episodes.name: The Simpsons in Plusaversary
episodes.overview: The Simpsons host a Disney+ Day party and everyone is on the list… except Homer. With friends from across the service and music fit for a Disney princess, Plusaversary is Springfield's event of the year.

episodes.name: When Billie Met Lisa
episodes.overview: When Lisa's practicing with her saxophone annoys the rest of the family, she is discovered by chart-topping artists Billie Eilish and Finneas while searching for a quiet place. Billie then invites Lisa to her studio for a special jam session.

episodes.name: Welcome To The Club
episodes.overview: Heart set on becoming a princess, Lisa Simpson is surprised to learn being bad might be more fun

episodes.name: The Simpsons Meet The Bocellis In Feliz Navidad
episodes.overview: This Christmas, Homer surprises Marge with the ultimate gift: an unforgettable performance from Italian opera superstar Andrea Bocelli and his children Matteo and Virginia.

episodes.name: Maggie Simpson in "Rogue Not Quite One"
episodes.overview: On their way to daycare, Homer loses track of Maggie who hops in Grogu's hovering pram for a hyperspace-hopping adventure across the galaxy.  Facing a squadron of Imperial TIE fighters, Maggie brings the battle to Springfield in this epic short celebrating all things Star Wars.

episodes.name: May The 12th Be With You
episodes.overview: It’s Mother’s Day and Marge Simpson joins the moms of Disney+ on a special holiday outing that turns into an epic galactic adventure filled with heroes, villains and a surprising old friend.

episodes.name: The Most Wonderful Time of the Year
episodes.overview: Sideshow Bob joins the villains of Disney+ for a new holiday carol...for Halloween!

episodes.name: O C'mon All Ye Faithful
episodes.overview: The residents of Springfield search for Christmas cheer.

episodes.name: The Past and the Furious
episodes.overview: Lisa travels back in time to save Springfield.

episodes.name: Yellow Planet
episodes.overview: The family is reimagined as animals in a nature mockumentary. Narrated in the style of National Geographic, the episode follows Homer and Marge as whales from different species drawn together by instinct, Bart as a newly hatched iguana fighting to survive against relentless predators, and Lisa as a finch leading her flock toward innovation. As each character faces the challenges of the natural world, familiar faces from Springfield appear in unexpected ways, bringing a fresh perspective to the struggle for survival in the wild.

episodes.name: Simpsons Roasting on an Open Fire
episodes.overview: When Homer doesn’t receive his Christmas bonus, and Marge having to spend the family's Christmas savings to erase Bart’s tattoo, he is forced to become a department store Santa to hide the fact he didn't get the bonus.

episodes.name: Bart the Genius
episodes.overview: After switching IQ tests with Martin, Bart is mistaken for a child genius. When he's enrolled in a school for gifted students, a series of embarrassments and mishaps makes him long for his old life.

episodes.name: Homer's Odyssey
episodes.overview: Homer is fired for nearly causing a meltdown at the nuclear plant. Unable to provide for his family, he contemplates ending it all - until he discovers a new life path as a campaigner for safety.

episodes.name: There's No Disgrace Like Home
episodes.overview: After an embarrassing experience at the company picnic, Homer pawns the TV and uses the proceeds to take the family to therapy sessions.

episodes.name: Bart the General
episodes.overview: Fed up with Nelson's bullying, the kids from Springfield Elementary decide to teach him a lesson. With advice from Grandpa, Bart leads them into battle.

episodes.name: Moaning Lisa
episodes.overview: When Lisa get a bad case of the blues, jazz musician Bleeding Gums Murphy teaches her how to express her feelings through music.

episodes.name: The Call of the Simpsons
episodes.overview: Homer buys an RV and the family takes off on an ill-fated camping trip.

episodes.name: The Telltale Head
episodes.overview: Bart tries to impress the school bullies by stealing the head of the Jebediah Springfield statue in the town square, but everyone is outraged by his act of vandalism.

episodes.name: Life on the Fast Lane
episodes.overview: Homer gives Marge a bowling ball for her birthday, and his self-serving gift backfires: she starts taking lessons from a suave French bowling instructor. When the lessons take a romantic turn, Marge faces temptation.

episodes.name: Homer's Night Out
episodes.overview: Bart puts his new spy camera to use when Homer gets rowdy at a bachelor party, and the incriminating photo gets distributed all over town.

episodes.name: The Crepes of Wrath
episodes.overview: Bart is sent as a foreign exchange student to France, where he is enslaved by corrupt winemakers. Meanwhile, the Simpson family hosts an Albanian student who takes a surprising interest in the workings of the nuclear power plant.

episodes.name: Krusty Gets Busted
episodes.overview: Krusty the Clown gets busted for robbing the Kwik-E-Mart, with Homer as an eyewitness. Convinced that their idol was wrongly accused, Bart and Lisa investigate the crime.

episodes.name: Some Enchanted Evening
episodes.overview: While Homer takes Marge out for a night on the town, the kids spot their babysitter on America's Most Armed and Dangerous.

episodes.name: Bart Gets an F
episodes.overview: In danger of flunking the fourth grade, Bart strikes a deal with the class brain: in exchange for tutoring, he will help Martin become more popular.

episodes.name: Simpson and Delilah
episodes.overview: After Homer charges a miracle hair growth treatment to the company's health insurance, his new found confidence gets him a promotion.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror
episodes.overview: The family moves into a haunted mansion, Aliens abduct the Simpsons and invite them to what might be their last supper, and Lisa reads Bart Edgar Allan Poe's classic poem "The Raven."

episodes.name: Two Cars in Every Garage and Three Eyes on Every Fish
episodes.overview: When a three-eyed fish is found in a nearby stream, the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant faces bad publicity and fails an inspection. Mr. Burns runs for governor, but his spin doctors are no match for Marge.

episodes.name: Dancin' Homer
episodes.overview: Homer becomes a local celebrity as the Springfield Isotopes' mascot. When he's promoted to the big leagues, the family moves to Capital City.

episodes.name: Dead Putting Society
episodes.overview: Competition erupts between neighbors when Todd Flanders and Bart enter a miniature golf tournament. Facing increasing pressure from their fathers, the boys find a way to settle things.

episodes.name: Bart vs. Thanksgiving
episodes.overview: Bart ruins Thanksgiving when he accidentally destroys Lisa's Thanksgiving centerpiece. Angry at being asked to apologize, he runs away and roams Springfield in search of dinner.

episodes.name: Bart the Daredevil
episodes.overview: Bart decides to emulate his hero, daredevil Lance Murdoch, and performs increasingly risky stunts on his skateboard. When he sets his sights on Springfield Gorge, Homer intervenes.

episodes.name: Itchy & Scratchy & Marge
episodes.overview: Marge wages a one-woman campaign against violence on the Itchy and Scratchy Show. She wins that battle, but draws the line at censoring Michelangelo's "David."

episodes.name: Bart Gets Hit by a Car
episodes.overview: After Mr. Burns hits Bart with his car, ambulance-chasing attorney Lionel Hutz persuades Homer and Marge to sue for a million dollars.

episodes.name: One Fish, Two Fish, Blowfish, Blue Fish
episodes.overview: After eating poisonous blowfish at a sushi restaurant, Homer decides to live life to the fullest in the 24 hours he has left to live.

episodes.name: The Way We Was
episodes.overview: When the TV breaks, Marge and Homer entertain the kids with the story of how they first met.

episodes.name: Homer vs. Lisa and the 8th Commandment
episodes.overview: Homer becomes the most popular guy in town when he gets an illegal cable hook-up, but Lisa fears he will go to hell for violating the Eighth Commandment.

episodes.name: Principal Charming
episodes.overview: When Marge begs Homer to find Selma a husband, he sets her up with Principal Skinner... who falls in love with Patty instead.

episodes.name: Oh Brother, Where Art Thou?
episodes.overview: Homer's long-lost half-brother is the CEO of a car company that's wildly successful... until he hires Homer to help design a car for the average man.

episodes.name: Bart's Dog Gets an F
episodes.overview: After a series of destructive acts, Homer decides that Santa's Little Helper must go unless he passes obedience school. As the dog's last hours with the family approach, Bart must find a way to get through to him.

episodes.name: Old Money
episodes.overview: When Grandpa's new girlfriend at the Springfield Retirement Castle dies, he inherits her savings and must decide the best way to spend his windfall.

episodes.name: Brush with Greatness
episodes.overview: Marge rediscovers her interest in art and takes up painting. When Mr. Burns hires her to paint his official portrait, Marge tries but fails to find his “inner beauty.”

episodes.name: Lisa's Substitute
episodes.overview: With Miss Hoover out sick, a substitute teacher takes over the class and becomes an inspiring role model for Lisa.

episodes.name: The War of the Simpsons
episodes.overview: At a lakeside retreat for married couples, Marge is determined to fix her marriage with Homer, but Homer is more determined to catch General Sherman, the freakishly large catfish that lives in the lake.

episodes.name: Three Men and a Comic Book
episodes.overview: Bart, Milhouse, and Martin pool their money to buy the first issue of Radioactive Man, but their investment and their friendship are threatened when they can't agree on who will keep it.

episodes.name: Blood Feud
episodes.overview: When Mr. Burns is saved by a transfusion of Bart's blood, Homer expects a handsome reward but is outraged to receive only a simple thank-you note.

episodes.name: Stark Raving Dad
episodes.overview: Mistakenly committed to a mental hospital, Homer meets a tall, stocky white man who claims to be Michael Jackson.

episodes.name: Mr. Lisa Goes to Washington
episodes.overview: Lisa’s patriotic essay wins the family a trip to Washington, D.C., but the corruption she sees there inspires her to write a new and very different essay.

episodes.name: When Flanders Failed
episodes.overview: When Ned Flanders opens a store for left-handed people, Homer wants him to fail...

episodes.name: Bart the Murderer
episodes.overview: Bart becomes an errand boy for the Springfield Mafia. When Principal Skinner disappears, Fat Tony points the finger at Bart.

episodes.name: Homer Defined
episodes.overview: Homer averts a meltdown through sheer dumb luck. When he’s invited to the Shelbyville Nuclear Power Plant to give a pep talk, he faces another potential meltdown and again “pulls a Homer.”

episodes.name: Like Father, Like Clown
episodes.overview: Bart and Lisa work to reunite Krusty the Clown with his estranged father, an Orthodox Jewish rabbi who had never accepted Krusty’s career choice.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror II
episodes.overview: The family buys a cursed monkey paw in Morocco, and their three wishes turn out badly. In a Twilight Zone parody, Bart is the fearsome “monster” who can read the townspeople’s thoughts. And Mr. Burns steals Homer’s brain for a giant robot he’s building.

episodes.name: Lisa's Pony
episodes.overview: Overcompensating for his neglect, Homer buys Lisa a pony. The high cost of maintaining the animal forces him to work the graveyard shift at the Kwik-E-Mart.

episodes.name: Saturdays of Thunder
episodes.overview: Homer tries to bond with Bart by building a soapbox racer. On race day, Bart must decide between driving Martin’s aerodynamic racer and disappointing Homer, or driving his own racer and losing to Nelson.

episodes.name: Flaming Moe's
episodes.overview: Moe steals the drink recipe Homer invented, and the rechristened “Flaming Moe” turns his tavern into a hotspot. When a national franchise wants to buy the recipe, Homer wants revenge.

episodes.name: Burns Verkaufen der Kraftwerk
episodes.overview: Mr. Burns sells the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant to wealthy German investors who are shocked at the conditions.

episodes.name: I Married Marge
episodes.overview: Homer and Marge recount their early years, when the couple faced a shotgun wedding and Homer’s poor career prospects.

episodes.name: Radio Bart
episodes.overview: Bart plays practical jokes with a radio microphone, and his hoax tests the limits of the town’s kindness.

episodes.name: Lisa the Greek
episodes.overview: Sundays become “Daddy-Daughter Days” when Homer discovers Lisa’s uncanny ability to pick winning football teams.

episodes.name: Homer Alone
episodes.overview: Marge has a nervous breakdown and goes on a vacation alone, leaving Bart and Lisa with Patty and Selma, and Maggie with Homer.

episodes.name: Bart the Lover
episodes.overview: Bart discovers his teacher’s personal ad and invents a fictional suitor to string her along. When Mrs. Krabappel falls madly in love with “Woodrow,” Bart’s conscience starts to bother him.

episodes.name: Homer at the Bat
episodes.overview: Homer and his co-workers qualify for the plant softball team's league final, but Mr. Burns hires nine professional MLB players in order to win a $1 million bet.

episodes.name: Separate Vocations
episodes.overview: When a career aptitude test pegs Lisa as a homemaker and Bart as a police officer, the results cause them to make 180-degree turns in their behavior.

episodes.name: Dog of Death
episodes.overview: After the Simpsons regret paying for an expensive surgery for Santa's Little Helper, he runs away from home and is trained by Mr. Burns to become an attack dog.

episodes.name: Colonel Homer
episodes.overview: Homer becomes the manager of a beautiful country music singer, whose attentions drive a wedge between Marge and Homer.

episodes.name: Black Widower
episodes.overview: When Selma agrees to marry her prison pen pal, Sideshow Bob, only Bart remains suspicious of his motives.

episodes.name: The Otto Show
episodes.overview: Otto loses his job driving the school bus and the Simpsons take him in. When he must get a driver’s license, he finds common ground with Patty and Selma.

episodes.name: Bart's Friend Falls in Love
episodes.overview: Everything’s coming up Milhouse when Bart’s best friend falls in love with the new girl at school. Jealous, Bart snitches to Milhouse’s father and the lovebirds are separated.

episodes.name: Brother, Can You Spare Two Dimes?
episodes.overview: After Homer "wins" a $2000 settlement with the plant for radiation affecting his sperm count, his brother Herb returns to Springfield with an idea that could help him get his fortune back.

episodes.name: Kamp Krusty
episodes.overview: When Bart and Lisa attend Kamp Krusty, they find the summer camp is more like a prison camp. When Krusty doesn't show up, the kids seize control and take their case to the media.

episodes.name: A Streetcar Named Marge
episodes.overview: Feeling underappreciated at home, Marge takes up acting and channels her pent-up rage as Blanche DuBois in a community production. Meanwhile, Maggie leads a revolt at the Ayn Rand School for Tots.

episodes.name: Homer the Heretic
episodes.overview: After skipping church one Sunday morning, Homer decides to quit church altogether and spend Sundays worshiping in his own way, with cigars and beer.

episodes.name: Lisa the Beauty Queen
episodes.overview: Homer enters Lisa into the Little Miss Springfield Pageant to help her feel better about her looks. But when she must choose between the title and her integrity, she realizes that confidence comes from within.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror III
episodes.overview: In "Clown Without Pity," Bart's Krusty doll is determined to murder Homer. In "King Homer," Homer plays King Kong to Marge's Fay Wray. Finally, in "Dial Z for Zombies," Bart finds a book of witchcraft and accidentally brings Springfield's dead to life.

episodes.name: Itchy & Scratchy: The Movie
episodes.overview: When Bart's misdeeds at school and at home reach new extremes, Homer puts his foot down and imposes the ultimate punishment: Bart is forbidden to go see the new Itchy & Scratchy movie.

episodes.name: Marge Gets a Job
episodes.overview: Mr. Burns is instantly smitten when Marge takes a job at the nuclear power plant.

episodes.name: The New Kid on the Block
episodes.overview: Bart has a crush on his new neighbor, a teenage girl who only has eyes for Jimbo Jones. Bart sets out to prove that Jimbo is not as tough as he seems.

episodes.name: Mr. Plow
episodes.overview: Homer starts a thriving snow-plowing business, but cutthroat competition arrives when Barney sets up shop as the "Plow King." When an avalanche buries Barney, Homer realizes the rivalry has gone too far.

episodes.name: Lisa's First Word
episodes.overview: While trying to get Maggie to say her first word, Marge and Homer reminisce about Bart's and Lisa's first words.

episodes.name: Homer's Triple Bypass
episodes.overview: Homer's doughnut-clogged heart needs a triple bypass operation, but Dr. Hibbert's fee is $40,000... so Homer takes his chances with Dr. Nick Riviera, who'll do any operation for $129.

episodes.name: Marge vs. the Monorail
episodes.overview: When Springfield gets a sudden windfall, a charismatic traveling salesman convinces the town to build a monorail.

episodes.name: Selma's Choice
episodes.overview: After seeing Aunt Gladys die alone, Aunt Selma wants to get married and have a baby... until she spends a day babysitting Bart and Lisa at Duff Gardens.

episodes.name: Brother From the Same Planet
episodes.overview: When Homer neglects Bart once too often, Bart goes to the Big Brother program to get a new father figure. Stung, Homer replaces Bart with a little brother.

episodes.name: I Love Lisa
episodes.overview: Ralph Wiggum mistakes pity for love when Lisa gives him a Valentine's Day card. After a public humiliation, broken-hearted Ralph gives an unexpectedly moving performance in the school's President's Day pageant.

episodes.name: Duffless
episodes.overview: After a DUI, Homer swears off beer for a month. Meanwhile, Bart and Lisa's sibling rivalry plays out in the school science fair.

episodes.name: Last Exit to Springfield
episodes.overview: Homer negotiates his union's contract with Mr. Burns, mindful that he needs a dental plan for Lisa's new braces. Burns mistakes Homer's utter ineptitude for strategy and concedes, on the condition that Homer resign as union president.

episodes.name: So It's Come to This: A Simpsons Clip Show
episodes.overview: An April Fools' Day prank provides the jumping-off point for Simpson family flashbacks.

episodes.name: The Front
episodes.overview: Convinced that Itchy & Scratchy has been going downhill, Bart and Lisa pen their own script and sign Grandpa Simpson's name to it. Meanwhile, Homer goes back to school to make up a missing credit.

episodes.name: Whacking Day
episodes.overview: Lisa takes a stand against Springfield's annual snake-bashing festival.

episodes.name: Marge in Chains
episodes.overview: Overwhelmed by her family's demands during a flu epidemic, Marge accidentally shoplifts at the Kwik-E-Mart and winds up in prison.

episodes.name: Krusty Gets Kancelled
episodes.overview: An advertising blitz for "Gabbo" spells trouble for Krusty: his show gets canceled when the new ventriloquist act gets higher ratings. Bart and Lisa enlist Krusty's Hollywood pals for a comeback special.

episodes.name: Homer's Barbershop Quartet
episodes.overview: Through flashbacks, Homer recalls the dizzying rise and fall of his Beatles-esque barbershop quartet. The Be Sharps reunite for one last concert on the roof of Moe's Tavern.

episodes.name: Cape Feare
episodes.overview: When Bart receives death threats from newly paroled Sideshow Bob, the family goes into the Witness Relocation Program and starts a new life on a houseboat on Terror Lake.

episodes.name: Homer Goes to College
episodes.overview: Burns discovers that Homer is grossly unqualified to be a nuclear safety inspector, so Homer enrolls at Springfield University to study nuclear physics. While there, Homer befriends three nerds and instigates a prank that gets them expelled.

episodes.name: Rosebud
episodes.overview: Mr. Burns pines away for Bobo, his beloved childhood teddy bear and symbol of lost innocence. When the bear turns up in Maggie's possession, the resulting tug of war affects the whole town.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror IV
episodes.overview: In "The Devil and Homer Simpson," Homer sells his soul for a doughnut. In "Terror at 5 1/2 Feet," everyone doubts Bart's sanity when he's the only one to see a gremlin sabotaging the school bus. In "Bart Simpson's Dracula," the family turns into vampires, and Lisa sends Homer to the Burns mansion in an attempt to kill the head vampire.

episodes.name: Marge on the Lam
episodes.overview: When Marge has a girls' night out with a new neighbor, they wind up roaring toward a cliff in a Thelma-and-Louise-style car chase.

episodes.name: Bart's Inner Child
episodes.overview: Bart heckles the guru at a self-help seminar, and the man presents him to the audience as a role model for their "inner child." But when the whole town tries to "be like Bart," things start to fall apart.

episodes.name: Boy-Scoutz 'N the Hood
episodes.overview: After joining the Junior Campers while on a sugar high, Bart reluctantly invites Homer to accompany him on the annual father-son rafting trip, which goes awry.

episodes.name: The Last Temptation of Homer
episodes.overview: Homer struggles with his attraction to new coworker Mindy, a beautiful engineer whose love for doughnuts is equal to his own.

episodes.name: $pringfield (or, How I Learned to Stop Worrying and Love Legalized Gambling)
episodes.overview: When gambling is legalized in Springfield, Mr. Burns opens an extravagant casino on the waterfront, where Marge becomes addicted to the slot machines.

episodes.name: Homer the Vigilante
episodes.overview: When a cat burglar prowls Springfield, Homer forms a vigilante group that winds up breaking more laws than they protect.

episodes.name: Bart Gets Famous
episodes.overview: Working as Krusty the Clown's assistant, Bart accidentally steals the limelight by blurting an instant catchphrase: "I didn't do it." But when he tries to capitalize on his fifteen minutes of fame, the fans are fickle.

episodes.name: Homer and Apu
episodes.overview: Fired for selling tainted meat to Homer, Apu tries to make amends to the Simpsons, and Homer joins him in a pilgrimage to Kwik-E-Mart headquarters in India.

episodes.name: Lisa vs. Malibu Stacy
episodes.overview: Lisa is shocked to find that her new Malibu Stacy doll reinforces negative stereotypes of women. With Smithers' help, Lisa tracks down the original creator of Malibu Stacy and convinces her to market a new doll that's a better role model for girls.

episodes.name: Deep Space Homer
episodes.overview: Dejected by a lack of recognition at work, Homer makes a crank call to NASA and winds up being chosen to ride into space with astronauts.

episodes.name: Homer Loves Flanders
episodes.overview: Homer and Flanders bond over a football game. As the two friends become inseparable, Flanders struggles with a growing dislike of Homer that finally blows up in front of the entire church congregation.

episodes.name: Bart Gets an Elephant
episodes.overview: Bart wins a wacky radio contest and forgoes the cash to claim the gag prize instead: an elephant.

episodes.name: Burns' Heir
episodes.overview: The childless Mr. Burns selects Bart as his heir and begins grooming him for his new role. As a test of loyalty, Mr. Burns orders Bart to fire Homer.

episodes.name: Sweet Seymour Skinner's Baadasssss Song
episodes.overview: When Bart gets Principal Skinner fired, Ned Flanders is brought in to act as principal. Skinner befriends his former nemesis and the pair look for a way to get Skinner reinstated.

episodes.name: The Boy Who Knew Too Much
episodes.overview: Bart witnesses the alleged assault of a waiter by Mayor Quimby's nephew, but coming forward will mean admitting to skipping class and facing the consequences.

episodes.name: Lady Bouvier's Lover
episodes.overview: Grampa falls in love with Marge's mother, but must compete with Mr. Burns for her heart.

episodes.name: Secrets of a Successful Marriage
episodes.overview: Homer teaches an adult education class on successful marriage, but his students show little interest until he starts telling them juicy details of his marriage to Marge. Furious, Marge kicks Homer out.

episodes.name: Bart of Darkness
episodes.overview: Stuck in his room with a broken leg, Bart hears a high-pitched scream. When he looks through his telescope, he sees a guilty Ned Flanders burying the evidence.

episodes.name: Lisa's Rival
episodes.overview: Lisa feels threatened when a new girl moves to Springfield: Allison is smart, pretty, a great saxophone player and a crack diorama builder. Lisa tries to befriend her new rival, but she's consumed with envy and competitiveness.

episodes.name: Another Simpsons Clip Show
episodes.overview: After reading the weepy best-seller The Bridges of Madison County, Marge sits down with the family and recalls romantic moments, along with temptations from her bowling instructor Jacques and Homer's coworker Mindy.

episodes.name: Itchy & Scratchy Land
episodes.overview: The family's trip to Itchy & Scratchy Land takes an unexpected turn when high-tech robots malfunction and become violent.

episodes.name: Sideshow Bob Roberts
episodes.overview: Backed by a cabal of Republicans and the talk radio blowhard Birch Barlow, Sideshow Bob runs for mayor of Springfield. When new mayor Bob decides to build a freeway right through the Simpson's' home, Bart and Lisa set out to prove the election was rigged.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror V
episodes.overview: In "The Shinning," Homer becomes groundskeeper of Mr. Burns' isolated mountain mansion. In "Time and Punishment," Homer tries to fix the toaster and winds up time traveling. In "Nightmare Cafeteria," Principal Skinner finds an ingenious way to reduce overcrowding in the detention room and deal with cafeteria budget cuts.

episodes.name: Bart's Girlfriend
episodes.overview: Smitten with Reverend Lovejoy's daughter Jessica, Bart tries to reform to win her heart, but what she really wants is a bad boy. When she steals the church collection plate, Bart finds he's in over his head.

episodes.name: Lisa on Ice
episodes.overview: When she nearly flunks gym class, Lisa is forced to take up a sport. She's a natural at hockey, but things get complicated when her team faces off against Bart's. In a tense moment on the ice, sibling rivalry melts into sibling loyalty.

episodes.name: Homer Badman
episodes.overview: When Homer gropes for a gummy candy stuck to the babysitter's pants, she mistakes his intentions and turns the town against him.

episodes.name: Grampa vs. Sexual Inadequacy
episodes.overview: Grandpa Simpson's miracle elixir reinvigorates Homer and Marge's sex life. When father and son embark on an old-fashioned medicine show to sell the love tonic, they rake in the money, but eventually old resentments bubble up between them.

episodes.name: Fear of Flying
episodes.overview: When they try to go on vacation, the family discovers Marge's debilitating fear of flying. Marge consults a psychoanalyst to find the source of her baffling fear.

episodes.name: Homer the Great
episodes.overview: Homer joins the secret society of the Stonecutters and is suddenly exalted when the brethren discover his birthmark. The ancient order is shaken to the core by the ineptitude of its new Chosen One.

episodes.name: And Maggie Makes Three
episodes.overview: The story of Maggie's birth is told in flashbacks: after Homer quits the Springfield Nuclear Power Plant to pursue his dream of working at a bowling alley, Marge reveals that she is pregnant.

episodes.name: Bart's Comet
episodes.overview: When Bart is forced to assist Principal Skinner in early-morning astronomy observations, he discovers a giant comet heading towards Springfield. Facing impending doom, the entire town shows up at the Flanders family bomb shelter.

episodes.name: Homie the Clown
episodes.overview: Krusty the Clown's reckless spending forces him to open a clown college to keep afloat. New graduate Homer discovers the perks and perils of being Krusty.

episodes.name: Bart vs. Australia
episodes.overview: After Bart's prank phone call to Australia goes awry, the Simpsons must fly out to the land down under and apologize to the Australian people. When they discover Bart's penalty will be a kick in the pants, international relations deteriorate.

episodes.name: Homer vs. Patty and Selma
episodes.overview: Desperate for money, Homer takes a loan from his sisters-in-law, Patty and Selma, who make him their slave. Bart discovers a natural talent for ballet.

episodes.name: A Star Is Burns
episodes.overview: The citizens of Springfield host their own film festival, with popular movie critic Jay Sherman arriving from New York to judge.

episodes.name: Lisa's Wedding
episodes.overview: A fortune teller foresees Lisa's future marriage to an upper-crust Harvard classmate. After a series of embarrassing incidents, Lisa comes to realize that even though her family may not be classy, she loves them the way they are.

episodes.name: Two Dozen and One Greyhounds
episodes.overview: When Santa's Little Helper sires a litter of puppies, Mr. Burns adopts them, secretly scheming to use their pelts to make a fur tuxedo. When Bart and Lisa confront Mr. Burns, he relents and turns the puppies into racing dogs instead.

episodes.name: The PTA Disbands
episodes.overview: A teachers' strike forces the Board of Education to enlist PTA members as substitute teachers. Realizing he preferred the old regime, Bart locks Skinner and Mrs. Krabappel in a room together until they can agree on the contract.

episodes.name: Round Springfield
episodes.overview: Lisa is reunited with her idol, Bleeding Gums Murphy, but their time together is short-lived. When the jazz legend passes away, a heartbroken Lisa wants to buy his rare album for $500 and play it on the local jazz station as a tribute.

episodes.name: The Springfield Connection
episodes.overview: After Marge helps catch a petty criminal, the adrenaline rush inspires her to join the Springfield Police Department, but police corruption makes her question her newfound calling.

episodes.name: Lemon of Troy
episodes.overview: The simmering rivalry between Springfield and a neighboring town heats up when Shelbyville kids steal Springfield's prized lemon tree.

episodes.name: Who Shot Mr. Burns? (1)
episodes.overview: In Part I of this two-part suspense story, Mr. Burns' evil schemes go too far. When Burns winds up shot, everyone is a suspect.

episodes.name: Who Shot Mr. Burns? (2)
episodes.overview: With Mr. Burns shot, Chief Wiggum investigates the crime, and nearly everyone in town has a motive. At the end, it all comes down to the Simpson DNA.

episodes.name: Radioactive Man
episodes.overview: Bart longs to play "Fallout Boy" in the new Radioactive Man movie, but the Van Houtens thrust Milhouse into the spotlight. Meanwhile, the town of Springfield sees an opportunity for profit.

episodes.name: Home Sweet Homediddily-Dum-Doodily
episodes.overview: When Homer and Marge are found to be unfit parents, the kids are placed with the Flanders family. Reluctant participants in the Flanderses' wholesome family activities, Bart and Lisa become the targets of an emergency baptism.

episodes.name: Bart Sells His Soul
episodes.overview: Bart sells his soul to Milhouse for five dollars, but soon regrets his decision. Meanwhile, Moe turns the Tavern into a family-friendly restaurant.

episodes.name: Lisa the Vegetarian
episodes.overview: After visiting a local petting zoo, Lisa becomes a vegetarian and faces ridicule from family and friends. When she lashes out and ruins Homer's barbecue, she learns a lesson in tolerance.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror VI
episodes.overview: In "Attack of the 50 Foot Eyesores," strange atmospheric conditions bring giant advertising statues to life. In "Nightmare on Evergreen Terrace," Groundskeeper Willie is killed in a freak accident and seeks revenge in the childrens' dreams. In the final segment, Homer steps through a secret portal and becomes three-dimensional.

episodes.name: King-Size Homer
episodes.overview: Homer tries to gain sixty pounds so he can stay home on disability. When he nearly causes a catastrophe at the plant, Homer reconsiders his plan.

episodes.name: Mother Simpson
episodes.overview: Homer discovers that his mother is still alive, a former radical who is a fugitive from the law. When her old nemesis Burns spots her and tips off the FBI, she is forced to return to the underground.

episodes.name: Sideshow Bob's Last Gleaming
episodes.overview: After Sideshow Bob escapes from prison, the Springfield Air Show is the setting for his ill-fated vendetta against television and Krusty the Clown.

episodes.name: The Simpsons 138th Episode Spectacular
episodes.overview: Troy McClure hosts a behind-the-scenes look at the show, including clips of the series' beginnings as filler on "The Tracy Ullman Show," Simpsons trivia questions, and unaired scenes from popular episodes.

episodes.name: Marge Be Not Proud
episodes.overview: Nabbed for shoplifting, Bart manages to keep it a secret from the family... until it's time to have the family Christmas photo taken at the Try-N-Save.

episodes.name: Team Homer
episodes.overview: Homer catches Mr. Burns in an ether-induced haze and asks for $500 for his bowling team. When Burns' head clears, he demands to join the team. Meanwhile, Bart's inflammatory T-shirt provokes Principal Skinner to require school uniforms.

episodes.name: Two Bad Neighbors
episodes.overview: Homer resents being upstaged when former president George Bush moves into the neighborhood. After Bush spanks Bart, an all-out prank war ensues.

episodes.name: Scenes from the Class Struggle in Springfield
episodes.overview: A chance encounter with a former classmate yields an invitation to the Springfield Country Club, where Marge tries to parlay a bargain basement Chanel suit into elevated social status for her family.

episodes.name: Bart the Fink
episodes.overview: In a scheme to get Krusty's autograph, Bart sends him a check. When Krusty's offshore holding corporation endorses the check, his illegal tax shelter is exposed. In despair after the government auctions off his possessions, Krusty fakes his own death.

episodes.name: Lisa the Iconoclast
episodes.overview: While researching into Jebediah Springfield's past for an essay, Lisa discovers that the town founder wasn't the hero that everyone thinks he was.

episodes.name: Homer the Smithers
episodes.overview: Forced to take a vacation, Smithers needs to find a temporary replacement who won't outshine him. Homer seems the perfect choice until a sudden outburst forces Mr. Burns to assert his independence.

episodes.name: The Day the Violence Died
episodes.overview: Bart meets the original animator who created Itchy,  penniless some 70 years after the studio stole his idea. When Bart helps him sue for restitution, he unwittingly bankrupts Itchy & Scratchy.

episodes.name: A Fish Called Selma
episodes.overview: Washed up and plagued by scandal, Troy McClure sees a marriage to Selma as his ticket back to success.

episodes.name: Bart on the Road
episodes.overview: Bart creates a fake driver's license for himself and uses it to go on a spring break road trip with Milhouse, Nelson, and Martin. Meanwhile, Homer and Lisa bond after spending some quality time together at work.

episodes.name: 22 Short Films About Springfield
episodes.overview: Bart and Milhouse wonder if anything interesting happens to the citizens of Springfield, which leads to a series of interconnected vignettes.

episodes.name: Raging Abe Simpson and his Grumbling Grandson in: 'The Curse of the Flying Hellfish'
episodes.overview: When a fellow veteran dies, Grandpa Simpson and Mr. Burns fight for buried WWII treasure as the only surviving members of their battalion.

episodes.name: Much Apu About Nothing
episodes.overview: When Mayor Quimby uses immigrants as a political scapegoat, the Simpsons discover that Apu is an illegal immigrant.

episodes.name: Homerpalooza
episodes.overview: To show his kids how hip he is, Homer takes Bart and Lisa to a music festival, where he earns himself a place in the sideshow by catching a cannonball with his belly.

episodes.name: Summer of 4 Ft. 2
episodes.overview: On a family vacation, Lisa tries on a new identity to fit in with the other kids at the beach. Jealous, Bart reveals her true nerdiness to the group.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror VII
episodes.overview: In "The Thing and I," Bart discovers his evil Siamese twin in the attic. In "The Genesis Tub," Lisa's science experiment becomes a quickly-developing micro-universe, where she is thought of as God and Bart is the devil. In "Citizen Kang," aliens replace Clinton and Dole just in time for the election.

episodes.name: You Only Move Twice
episodes.overview: When Homer accepts a job offer, the Simpsons move to Cypress Creek, where everything seems too good to be true. Finally happy at his job, Homer fails to notice that his new boss is an evil megalomaniac bent on world domination.

episodes.name: The Homer They Fall
episodes.overview: When Moe sees that Homer can absorb massive blows to the head, he turns him into a prizefighter and sets up a match with heavyweight champion Drederick Tatum.

episodes.name: Burns Baby Burns
episodes.overview: Mr. Burns' boorish long-lost son Larry gets the brush-off from Burns, but Homer hatches a plan to reconcile them.

episodes.name: Bart After Dark
episodes.overview: After trespassing and damaging property at a mysterious old house, Bart is required to work  there as a punishment... but it turns out to be a burlesque house.

episodes.name: A Milhouse Divided
episodes.overview: Kirk and Luann Van Houten are getting a divorce. Homer is confident that it will never happen to him, but Kirk tells him how quickly things can change.

episodes.name: Lisa's Date With Density
episodes.overview: Lisa develops a crush on Nelson and tries to change him into a better person. Meanwhile, Homer finds an autodialer and starts a telemarketing scam.

episodes.name: Hurricane Neddy
episodes.overview: A hurricane destroys the Flanders' home and they have to move into the church basement. The people of Springfield gather to rebuild their house, but when Ned sees the poor workmanship, he has a complete breakdown.

episodes.name: El Viaje Misterioso de Nuestro Jomer (The Mysterious Voyage of Our Homer)
episodes.overview: After eating a dish laced with potent peppers during the chili cookoff, Homer has hallucinations where a mystical coyote urges him to find his soulmate.

episodes.name: The Springfield Files
episodes.overview: Homer witnesses something out of this world in Springfield woods, but no one believes him, not even FBI agents Fox Mulder and Dana Scully, who come to investigate the incident.

episodes.name: The Twisted World of Marge Simpson
episodes.overview: Marge's new pretzel franchise is failing until Homer strikes a deal with Fat Tony, Springfield's local mobster.

episodes.name: Mountain of Madness
episodes.overview: To promote teamwork amongst the power plant's employees, Mr. Burns makes them go on a corporate retreat up in the mountains.

episodes.name: Simpsoncalifragilisticexpiala (Annoyed Grunt) cious
episodes.overview: Marge is stressed by the demands of motherhood and the Simpsons get a magical British nanny, who floats down from the sky holding an umbrella.

episodes.name: The Itchy & Scratchy & Poochie Show
episodes.overview: In an attempt to boost ratings, the Itchy and Scratchy Show adds a new "in-your-face" character voiced by Homer.

episodes.name: Homer's Phobia
episodes.overview: The Simpsons befriend a shop owner, but when Homer discovers the man is gay, he worries about his influence on Bart.

episodes.name: Brother From Another Series
episodes.overview: When Sideshow Bob is released from prison, his brother Cecil puts him in charge of building Springfield's new hydroelectric dam.

episodes.name: My Sister, My Sitter
episodes.overview: Lisa has a stellar reputation as a babysitter, but when Homer and Marge leave her in charge of Bart and Maggie, everything starts going wrong.

episodes.name: Homer vs. the 18th Amendment
episodes.overview: When Prohibition is revived in Springfield, Homer and Bart supply the town with alcohol.

episodes.name: Grade School Confidential
episodes.overview: Bart discovers Principal Skinner and Mrs. Krabappel kissing, and it's not long before the whole town knows of their secret affair.

episodes.name: The Canine Mutiny
episodes.overview: When Bart can't pay the credit card bill for his expensive new purebred dog, the repo men unwittingly take Santa's Little Helper.

episodes.name: The Old Man and the Lisa
episodes.overview: Financially ruined, Mr. Burns turns to Lisa for help in building a recycling business. Lisa believes he's changed, but his new business venture takes a shocking new direction.

episodes.name: In Marge We Trust
episodes.overview: Disturbed that Reverend Lovejoy has lost interest in counseling parishioners, Marge volunteers as the "Listen Lady." Meanwhile, Homer sees his likeness on a box of Japanese detergent.

episodes.name: Homer's Enemy
episodes.overview: A hardworking new employee at the power plant is consumed with resentment at Homer's undeserved success.

episodes.name: The Simpsons Spin-Off Showcase
episodes.overview: Troy McClure presents three Simpsons spinoff spoofs: In "Chief Wiggum, P.I.," Chief Wiggum becomes a New Orleans detective. Next, Grampa Simpson's soul is trapped inside Moe's Love tester machine in "The Love-Matic Grampa." Finally, the Simpson family hosts a '70s-style variety show.

episodes.name: The Secret War of Lisa Simpson
episodes.overview: When Bart is sent to military school after playing a prank on the town, Lisa decides to join him... as the school's only girl cadet.

episodes.name: The City of New York vs. Homer Simpson
episodes.overview: Homer must travel to New York to get his car back, which is illegally parked at World Trade Center Plaza.

episodes.name: The Principal and the Pauper
episodes.overview: Unmasked as an impostor, Principal Skinner flees to Capital City to reclaim his former life as a shiftless good-for-nothing. The people of Springfield gain a newfound appreciation for him and form a plan to bring him back.

episodes.name: Lisa's Sax
episodes.overview: After Lisa’s saxophone is destroyed, the Simpsons reminisce about how she originally got the instrument. On the hottest day of the year, Homer must decide whether to buy an air conditioner or replace Lisa’s sax.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror VIII
episodes.overview: In “The Homega Man,” Homer faces a post-apocalyptic Springfield. Next, Bart attempts to become Superfly in "Fly vs. Fly." In “Easy-Bake Coven,” amidst a witch hunt in 1649, Marge and her sisters invent trick-or-treating.

episodes.name: The Cartridge Family
episodes.overview: Alarmed by a soccer riot, Homer buys a handgun. His reckless behavior drives Marge and the kids out of the house, and even his new gun club buddies desert him.

episodes.name: Bart Star
episodes.overview: When Homer becomes the coach of a peewee football team, he replaces star quarterback Nelson with the less talented Bart. Facing his teammates’ scorn, Bart looks for a way out but finds a better way to show his team spirit.

episodes.name: The Two Mrs. Nahasapeemapetilons
episodes.overview: Trying to escape his arranged marriage, Apu asks Marge to pose as his wife during his mother’s visit. When the ruse fails, Homer makes a last-ditch attempt to intervene, but Apu is smitten with his new bride Manjula.

episodes.name: Lisa the Skeptic
episodes.overview: When a skeleton is unearthed at the site of a future shopping mall, all Springfield is convinced it is the skeleton of an angel – except Lisa.

episodes.name: Realty Bites
episodes.overview: When Marge gets her real estate license, she learns to put a positive spin on the flaws of the houses she’s selling. But when the Flanders buy the Murder House, she realizes she has to tell the truth.

episodes.name: Miracle on Evergreen Terrace
episodes.overview: When Bart accidentally burns down the family's Christmas tree and gifts, he claims that a robber stole everything. When Kent Brockman does a human interest story on the family’s tragic loss, the townspeople shower the family with generosity… until the truth comes out.

episodes.name: All Singing, All Dancing
episodes.overview: Homer rents a Clint Eastwood movie and is dismayed to find it's a musical. Using clips from past episodes, the rest of the family reminds him about the many times he and other members of the family and town have broken into song and dance.

episodes.name: Bart Carny
episodes.overview: When the carnival comes to town, Homer and Bart wind up working the ring toss. A father-son team of grifters shows them the downside of the “carny code,” but the Simpsons beat them at their own game.

episodes.name: The Joy of Sect
episodes.overview: A cult lures in most of Springfield to toil for “The Leader.” After Marge escapes and has the family deprogrammed, Homer exposes the man behind the spaceship.

episodes.name: Das Bus
episodes.overview: When Otto drives the school bus off a bridge, the kids wind up on a deserted island, fending for themselves in a “Lord of the Flies” parody. Back in Springfield, Homer takes on Bill Gates.

episodes.name: The Last Temptation of Krust
episodes.overview: Krusty bombs at a charity comedy event and feels like a tired old hack. With the Simpsons’ support, Krusty takes his act in a fresh new direction… but in the end, his true nature asserts itself.

episodes.name: Dumbbell Indemnity
episodes.overview: Moe goes broke trying to wine and dine a new girlfriend. Desperate for money, he cooks up an insurance scam with Homer.

episodes.name: Lisa the Simpson
episodes.overview: Lisa struggles with solving a simple puzzle and fears that the "Simpson gene” is suddenly wiping out her intelligence. Homer stages a family reunion in hopes of introducing Lisa to some Simpsons she can respect.

episodes.name: This Little Wiggy
episodes.overview: At Marge’s insistence, Bart has a “play date” with Ralph. Bart suddenly sees the upside of this friendship when he discovers Chief Wiggum’s “master key” and goes to explore Springfield’s abandoned prison.

episodes.name: Simpson Tide
episodes.overview: When Homer joins the Naval Reserve, a captain takes a liking to him and leaves him in charge of a nuclear submarine.

episodes.name: The Trouble With Trillions
episodes.overview: Facing an IRS audit, Homer agrees to help the feds bust Mr. Burns for a missing trillion-dollar bill. When Burns makes an anti-government stand, Homer flees with him to Cuba.

episodes.name: Girly Edition
episodes.overview: Lisa becomes the anchor of a kids’ news program but is upstaged by Bart’s treacly human interest stories. At home, Homer corrupts a helper monkey.

episodes.name: Trash of the Titans
episodes.overview: Homer feuds with the Springfield garbage men and decides to run for Sanitation Commissioner. After winning the election with a sleazy campaign, Homer can’t keep the extravagant promises he made to the town.

episodes.name: King of the Hill
episodes.overview: After Rainier Wolfcastle helps Homer get in shape, Homer accepts a challenge to climb the Murderhorn, the tallest mountain in Springfield.

episodes.name: Lost Our Lisa
episodes.overview: Bart’s latest stunt thwarts Lisa’s plan to attend a museum exhibit. When she tries to go alone and takes the wrong bus, Homer sets out to find her.

episodes.name: Natural Born Kissers
episodes.overview: Homer and Marge try to spice up their love life and are caught baring it all in public. Bart and Lisa discover an alternate ending to Casablanca.

episodes.name: Lard of the Dance
episodes.overview: Homer and Bart try to make money by selling used grease. Meanwhile, Lisa organizes a school dance but feels alienated when a new classmate and her friends try to act like adults.

episodes.name: The Wizard of Evergreen Terrace
episodes.overview: A midlife crisis prompts Homer to quit his job and become an inventor.

episodes.name: Bart the Mother
episodes.overview: Under Nelson's bad influence, Bart shoots a bird with a BB gun. Stricken with remorse, he tries to nurture the eggs from the bird's nest, which hatch into a species of lizard outlawed in Springfield.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror IX
episodes.overview: In "Hell Toupée," Snake is sent to the electric chair, and his hair is transplanted onto Homer. In "The Terror of Tiny Toon," Bart and Lisa become cartoon characters in an episode of Itchy & Scratchy. In "Starship Poopers," a growth spurt casts doubt on Maggie's paternity, and the family goes on the Jerry Springer show.

episodes.name: When You Dish Upon a Star
episodes.overview: After a chance encounter with Hollywood celebrities secretly living in Springfield, Homer becomes their friend and gofer... until he spills the beans to the gang at Moe's.

episodes.name: D'oh-in in the Wind
episodes.overview: In a quest to learn Homer's middle name, Homer and Grandpa travel to his mother's old commune, where Homer embraces the hippie life.

episodes.name: Lisa Gets an A
episodes.overview: When Lisa cheats on a test, she has a moral crisis when her perfect score qualifies the school for grant money. Homer adopts a lobster as a pet.

episodes.name: Homer Simpson in: 'Kidney Trouble'
episodes.overview: When Grandpa needs a new kidney, Homer agrees to donate one, but then chickens out.

episodes.name: Mayored to the Mob
episodes.overview: After saving him from a riot at a Sci-Fi convention, Mayor Quimby hires Homer as his bodyguard. When Homer takes a stand, he runs afoul of the Springfield mafia.

episodes.name: Viva Ned Flanders
episodes.overview: When clean-living Ned Flanders wants to experience a new side of life, Homer takes him to Las Vegas. After a drunken binge, they marry a pair of cocktail waitresses.

episodes.name: Wild Barts Can't Be Broken
episodes.overview: Scapegoated for the vandalism of drunken Isotopes fans, the children of Springfield wage war on the adults by broadcasting their secrets on the radio.

episodes.name: Sunday, Cruddy Sunday
episodes.overview: Homer and his friends charter a bus to the Super Bowl, only to find that their tickets are fake. Misadventures ensue.

episodes.name: Homer to the Max
episodes.overview: Homer changes his name to "Max Power" after discovering that he shares his name with a dimwitted TV character.

episodes.name: I'm with Cupid
episodes.overview: Apu is making the husbands of Springfield look bad with his extravagent Valentine's Day efforts for Manjula. When the men try to sabotage Apu's grand gesture, they accidentally wind up benefiting from it.

episodes.name: Marge Simpson in: 'Screaming Yellow Honkers'
episodes.overview: A new Canyonero SUV turns timid Marge into an aggressive driver, and her road rage lands her in traffic school. But when a stampede occurs at the zoo, the town looks to Marge to save the day.

episodes.name: Make Room for Lisa
episodes.overview: Indebted from a mishap at the Smithsonian, Homer lets a cell phone company put a transmitter in the house. Forced to share a room with Bart, Lisa resents Homer until a New Age experience gives her empathy.

episodes.name: Maximum Homerdrive
episodes.overview: After beating Homer in a steak-eating competition, a trucker dies; Homer and Bart take over his rig to complete his shipment.

episodes.name: Simpsons Bible Stories
episodes.overview: When Reverend Lovejoy subjects the congregation to an extended Bible reading, the Simpsons fall asleep and have dreams based on Bible stories.

episodes.name: Mom and Pop Art
episodes.overview: Homer's failed do-it-yourself project gets mistaken for "outsider art." Suddenly in the limelight, Homer must come up with new "works" to impress the art world.

episodes.name: The Old Man and the C Student
episodes.overview: When Bart ruins Springfield's chance to host the Olympics, the kids are sentenced to community service work at the retirement home. To help the residents recapture their youth, Bart takes them on an ill-fated boat ride.

episodes.name: Monty Can't Buy Me Love
episodes.overview: A new mogul wins the hearts of the townspeople with a shower of cash. Jealous, Mr. Burns asks Homer to help make him a beloved billionaire too, and they hatch a plan to bring the Loch Ness Monster to Springfield.

episodes.name: They Saved Lisa's Brain
episodes.overview: Mayor Quimby flees Springfield, leaving the town chapter of Mensa in charge. As the group's new power goes to their heads, they take their utopian plans too far and the townspeople revolt.

episodes.name: Thirty Minutes Over Tokyo
episodes.overview: After their bank account is drained at a cyber-cafe, the Simpsons go on a disastrous low-budget trip to Japan, where they wind up as contestants on a humiliating game show.

episodes.name: Beyond Blunderdome
episodes.overview: Homer befriends Mel Gibson just as Mel is completing a remake of Mr. Smith Goes To Washington. Homer convinces Mel to make the film more violent, with disastrous results.

episodes.name: Brother's Little Helper
episodes.overview: Bart is put on medication to control his behavior, but the pills cause him to become paranoid and insane.

episodes.name: Guess Who's Coming to Criticize Dinner?
episodes.overview: With Lisa's help, Homer uses his vast knowledge of food to become the town's leading restaurant critic. But when he gets petty and vindictive in his criticisms, all the other chefs in town try to kill him.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror X
episodes.overview: In "I Know What You Diddily-Iddly-Did" the SImpsons fear they have killed Ned Flanders. "Desperately Xeeking Xena" satirizes superheroes of yore with "Stretch Dude" Bart and "Clobber Girl" Lisa. And "Life's A Glitch, Then You Die" depicts the upcoming horror of Y2K.

episodes.name: E-I-E-I-(Annoyed Grunt)
episodes.overview: Fleeing from a duel, Homer takes his family to live on a farm. There he discovers that by mixing tomatoes, tobacco and radioactivity from the nuclear plant, he can create a dangerously delicious new substance.

episodes.name: Hello Gutter, Hello Fadder
episodes.overview: Homer bowls a perfect 300 game, then concludes that the greatest accomplishment of his life is behind him. He reconnects with the world by bonding with baby Maggie.

episodes.name: Eight Misbehavin'
episodes.overview: Due to overuse of fertility medication, Apu and wife Manjula give birth to octuplets. Desperate for money, Apu loans the babies to an unscrupulous carny promoter, then needs Homer's help to get them back.

episodes.name: Take My Wife, Sleaze
episodes.overview: After winning a motorcycle at a dance contest, Homer becomes part of a motorcycle gang. But when he puts Marge's photo in a biker magazine, a much tougher gang takes her, and he must win her back.

episodes.name: Grift of the Magi
episodes.overview: In this Christmas-themed episode, the students of Springfield Elementary are unwittingly used as a focus group to test new toys. The product of their labors, a cuddly doll named Funzo, is a lot more sinister than he appears.

episodes.name: Little Big Mom
episodes.overview: When Marge leaves the house to recuperate from a skating injury, everything goes to hell - until Lisa convinces Homer and Bart they have leprosy.

episodes.name: Faith Off
episodes.overview: Homer gets a bucket stuck on his head, and when it is removed the town is convinced that Bart has the powers of a faith healer. Then mobster Fat Tony tries to turn the boy's spiritual abilities into more sinister directions.

episodes.name: The Mansion Family
episodes.overview: Worried about his health, Mr. Burns visits the Mayo Clinic. He lets Homer housesit his mansion, which leads of course to an offshore knife fight and an attack by Chinese pirates.

episodes.name: Saddlesore Galactica
episodes.overview: Homer and Bart befriend a diving horse at a county fair. They turn it into a racehorse with an attitude, whose success runs them afoul of mysterious, tree-dwelling jockeys.

episodes.name: Alone Again, Natura-Diddily
episodes.overview: Ned's wife Maude is inadvertently killed by a T-shirt accident at an auto race. Homer and his family try to help Ned cope.

episodes.name: Missionary: Impossible
episodes.overview: When Homer fails to give money he promised over the phone, he is forced by PBS stars to flee the country. He becomes a missionary on a small tropical island, where he introduces the natives to casino gambling.

episodes.name: Pygmoelian
episodes.overview: Plastic surgery gives Moe the bartender a handsome new face and a whole new life as a soap opera star.

episodes.name: Bart to the Future
episodes.overview: We see a possible future in which Bart is a grown-up slacker, living with Ralph Wiggum, while Lisa is no less than President of the United States.

episodes.name: Days of Wine and D'ohses
episodes.overview: After being embarrassed by a drunken video of himself, Barney vows to sober up. Newly clean, he gets work as a helicopter pilot.

episodes.name: Kill the Alligator and Run
episodes.overview: After a terrible bout with insomnia, Homer takes the family to Florida during spring break. There, they kill a beloved alligator and are sentenced to a chain gang.

episodes.name: Last Tap Dance in Springfield
episodes.overview: Lisa enters a tap dancing academy, where the teacher is a child star who never quite grew up. Meanwhile, Homer gets laser eye surgery.

episodes.name: It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Marge
episodes.overview: When Otto dumps his bride at the altar, she goes to live with the Simpsons - and the family comes to believe that Marge has lost her mind.

episodes.name: Behind the Laughter
episodes.overview: In this satire of VH1's "Behind The Music," we learn the secrets of the Simpsons' rise, fall, and ultimate success.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror XI
episodes.overview: In "G-G-Ghost D-D-Dad" Homer dies after eating broccoli, but must perform a good deed within 24 hours to get into Heaven. In "Scary Tales Can Come True" Bart and Lisa encounter a witch in a gingerbread house. And in "Night of the Dolphin" super-intelligent dolphins strike back at humanity.

episodes.name: A Tale of Two Springfields
episodes.overview: Springfield is split in two when Homer revolts when his area code is changed; the new town walls itself off from the neighbors.

episodes.name: Insane Clown Poppy
episodes.overview: After he learns he has a daughter, Krusty turns to Homer for parenting advice.

episodes.name: Lisa the Tree Hugger
episodes.overview: Lisa's crush on an environmental activist inspires her to live in a redwood tree threatened by loggers.

episodes.name: Homer vs. Dignity
episodes.overview: Desperate for money, Homer accepts payment from Mr. Burns in exchange for humiliating himself.

episodes.name: The Computer Wore Menace Shoes
episodes.overview: As Mr. X, Homer starts his own web page where he reveals Springfield's secrets. But when his information runs out, he resorts to making up news. When one of his stories turns out to be true, he is kidnapped and taken to "The Island," a place where those who know too much are taken out of society.

episodes.name: The Great Money Caper
episodes.overview: The whole town of Springfield conspires to teach Homer and Bart a lesson after the pair begin running confidence scams.

episodes.name: Skinner's Sense of Snow
episodes.overview: A freak blizzard traps the students of Springfield Elementary inside their school. Their lives at stake, they are at the mercy of the rescue efforts of a woozy Homer and Ned.

episodes.name: HOMЯ
episodes.overview: An X-ray reveals a crayon lodged in Homer's brain. After the crayon is removed, Homer experiences a sudden surge in intelligence, making him closer to Lisa and isolated from his friends.

episodes.name: Pokey Mom
episodes.overview: Marge befriends a convict with an artistic streak. Homer battles the chiropractic industry after he creates a miracle back pain cure.

episodes.name: Worst Episode Ever
episodes.overview: Bart and Milhouse are left in charge of the comic book store after Comic Book Guy is hospitalised, who begins an unusual relationship with Principal Skinner's mother.

episodes.name: Tennis the Menace
episodes.overview: Homer installs a tennis court in the backyard, but his lousy playing creates a rift in the family.

episodes.name: Day of the Jackanapes
episodes.overview: When a new television game show grows in popularity and begins to draw away Krusty's TV audience, he decides to retire from the television business.

episodes.name: New Kids on the Blecch
episodes.overview: A music producer offers Bart and his friends a chance to participate in an up-and-coming boyband, but the boys are not up to it after making a discovery.

episodes.name: Hungry Hungry Homer
episodes.overview: Homer is forced to go on a hunger strike by the Springfield Isotopes after uncovering a secret plan to have the baseball team moved to New Mexico.

episodes.name: Bye Bye Nerdy
episodes.overview: Problems with a bully lead Lisa to examine just what makes bullies aggressive. Homer gets into the baby-proofing business.

episodes.name: Simpson Safari
episodes.overview: The Simpsons win a trip to Africa after Homer finds a golden animal cracker from the 60's in the loft.

episodes.name: Trilogy of Error
episodes.overview: Homer's rush to the hospital to re-attach his severed thumb, Lisa's rush to school to win the science fair, and Bart's run-in with an illegal fireworks scheme interconnect from their points of view.

episodes.name: I'm Goin' to Praiseland
episodes.overview: With Homer's help, Flanders tries to establish a Christian theme park based on drawings in Maude's sketch book.

episodes.name: Children of a Lesser Clod
episodes.overview: After a debilitating injury forces him to stay indoors, Homer begins a daycare center, making Bart and Lisa jealous.

episodes.name: Simpsons Tall Tales
episodes.overview: A hobo tells the Simpsons three tall tales on a train ride to Delaware: Homer as Paul Bunyan, Lisa as Connie Appleseed, and Bart and Nelson as Tom Sawyer and Huck Finn.

episodes.name: Treehouse of Horror XII
episodes.overview: In “Hex and the City” a gypsy puts a curse on Homer. In “House of Whack” the Simpsons' new automated house malfunctions and tries to kill Homer. And in “Wiz Kids” Bart and Lisa attend a school for wizards.

episodes.name: The Parent Rap
episodes.overview: After Bart takes a joyride in a police car, a judge orders him to be tethered to Homer at all times.

episodes.name: Homer the Moe
episodes.overview: Moe leaves Homer in charge of the bar to return to bartending school, until he returns and renovates shady bar into a hipster hangout, forcing Homer to set up "a hunting club" in his garage.

episodes.name: Hunka Hunka Burns in Love
episodes.overview: Homer's foray into the fortune writing business leads to a romance for Mr. Burns, who seeks advice from Homer to impress her.

episodes.name: The Blunder Years
episodes.overview: A hypnotist triggers a traumatic experience from Homer's childhood.

episodes.name: She of Little Faith
episodes.overview: Homer and Bart get careless with a model rocket and accidentally do damage to Springfield's church, but when Mr. Burns offers to commercialize it to repair the destruction, Lisa leaves Christianity behind to become a Buddhist.

episodes.name: Brawl in the Family
episodes.overview: A social services officer brings unity to the Simpson family, but their newfound happiness is threatened when the cocktail waitresses Homer and Ned drunkly married in Vegas shows up at their doors.

episodes.name: Sweets and Sour Marge
episodes.overview: Marge rallies for a ban on sugar after Springfield is declared America's fattest town.

episodes.name: Jaws Wired Shut
episodes.overview: When Homer breaks his jaw in an accident, his mouth is wired shut for a month.
